thread.title: Abortion in Ireland: ‘I had to wait for a stillbirth’
thread.title_full: Abortion in Ireland: ‘I had to wait for a stillbirth’

title: Abortion in Ireland: ‘I had to wait for a stillbirth’
text:
Media playback is unsupported on your device Abortion in Ireland: ‘I had to wait for a stillbirth’ 8 March 2017 Last updated at 07:45 GMT 
Ireland has a near-total ban on abortion, pushing thousands of women every year to travel abroad and others to break the law by taking abortion pills. 
Ahead of planned protests against the law on Wednesday, we spoke to women affected by the law, and the campaigners from both sides of a bitter divide. 
Video produced by Mohamed Madi and Joel Gunter. Related Topics
